page.title: 16NATURE RESERVE
page.content: The reserve lies immediately to the west of Redcar ,in an area that was originally saltmarsh.It is probably the most ecologically valuable wetland area south of the Tees in Cleveland. Due to drainage and land filling,only about 50 acres remain as fresh water marsh.The rest of the reserve consists of landscaped mounds and pools.A drainage canal which runs through the marshland broadens at the western end into a sedged_fringed pool.The total reserve area is 54 hectares. Until 1850,Coatham Marsh extended to the river Tees and the monks from Guisbrough collected salt from 3 salt hills on the marsh.Successive develop_ ments reduced the marsh to the present 50acres of freshwater marsh, but the reserve also includes newly mounded land with 2 interesting lakes, con_ structed 10 yrs ago on a refuse tip.
